direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And Gracie. She nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mitch?, I can't... I couldn't stand for this to... (destroy our lives) I'm happy, I've really been happy, and I don't want to - (give that up)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You won't have to. Believe me. She's nothing, she's no-one -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You... Damn it! You said I was safe with you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are, Slim. You are. I promise. They fall into an embrace. We feel how keenly they need each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KITCHEN. NIGHT. They're hugging. Begin TIGHT on them. At first it seems like this is the same embrace shot from a different angle. Then we see we're in the kitchen, his briefcase is at his side; their clothes are different.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We watch Slim's expression slowly change. From pleasure. To confusion. Pain. Outrage. She whispers:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I smell her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her perfume. Darcelle or whoever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (intense, sad) How many, Mitch? How many are there? How many have there been?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What does it matter? A stunning statement. Even more stunning because of the casual way he says it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean what're you saying here, that I don't deserve to get laid? Please. I'm a man, Slim. With the pregnancies, Gracie, you don't have time and energy like you used to, and I understand that, I really do. Men and women have different needs, and that's okay. Darcelle is willing to take care of it, and maybe that's better for everybody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Including you? He contemplates his answer...and shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! No! No!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Calm down, Slim - Wild, violently invading his space and assaulting his authority, screaming at him, her face just inches from his:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't do this anymore! I can't! Just take it, and take it, and take it!? I'm not strong enough! I don't know who would be. I love you, okay? I love you and I'm your wife and you can't do this! You understand me?!!! No more! No more! With the same speed he attacked "Our Hero" at the diner, Mitch's hand shoots out like a snake striking. Slaps her. A warning: stop it and stop it now. Her face: shock. Confusion. Outrage. She raises her hand to her cheek. Touches her skin where his fist landed... He reads her expression and is almost amused:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What, I can't hit you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (low, strong) No. You can't. He hits her again, this time with a closed fist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Knocking her to the ground. Stands over her like a boxer. Sees rase flare across her face -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want to fight? I'm a mom, honey; it's no contest. She's silent, but we see (very small) her reaction: Oh yeah??
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: {CONT.} You have to understand, Slim. I thought you did: make the money here, so I set the rules, right? It's my rules. He waits for her response, but again she's silent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You with me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's your rules.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. She keeps her voice meek so as not to offend:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And if I don't like the rules??
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you don't "like" them?! She nods cautiously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: {CONT.} Come on. Life isn't onl stuff we like. We take the good with the bad, right? That's what life is, what marriage is. So maybe, for you, today is a bad day. Tomorrow may be great.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tomorrow may be great.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tomorrow will be great. (Without you . ) He appears to miss her inference.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Today is the price you pay for having such a good life. She stares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going out. She says nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: {CONT.} This is gonna be better, don't you think? She just cannot process the absurdity of this statement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: {CONT.} I don't have to sneak around, pretend I'm going to work. I can just say: "I'm going to Darcelle's, I'll be back in a few hours." Her face is completely blank. He bends down, gives her a kiss on the head. We feel her skin crawl. She watches him go. Waits. Hears the front door close. She gets up, walks to the window, watches him walk toward his car. She turns away, looks at the room. We HEAR his car start. She goes to the phone. Thinks. Starts to dial-slowly, deliberately... Shock: RAP AT THE WINDOW! He's there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She reacts with guilt, but he doesn't look angry now. Behind him is his idling Mercedes convertible, driver's door open... He motions for her to open the window. She does.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who you calling?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your mother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What're you gonna tell her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm supposed to bring Gracie tomorrow. Maybe I better cancel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was thinking. You...you know that I adore you, but if you ever want...if you want out... For a second he can't talk. He's choked up. She watches coldly. His emotion appears real, but who cares?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) .I'll understand. I really will. (ALMOST TENDER) But there's one thing: you can't have Gracie. She's my daughter. Don't even think about taking her. Slim stares at him. He adds calmly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) If I see that thought even cross your mind, I'll kill you. There. He's said what he needs to. He walks toward his car. She shuts the window. Stares after him. In an odd and defiant way, she starts to whistle. Loudly. To herself. Almost daring him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He keeps walking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CAR. DAY. Emotional, impressionistic. CLOSE ON her face, almost inside her skin: a visual symphony. The countryside behind her is out of focus, a blur. She pulls up at a gate, punches in a code. Drives up a long a driveway to:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: JAGUARs lined up. At a respectful distance sit an old Toyota (the maid's car) and a pick-up (the gardener's truck). Slim parks near the truck. Her hand moves to the door handle, but she can't bring herself to open it. She sits... paralyzed, a failure. In this prolonged pause, Mrs. Tyler bursts out of the house -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TYLER You're late, you're late, I was worried you wouldn't comet (looks, realizes) No Gracie? Slim shakes her head. Mrs. Tyler is clearly disappointed, but quickly covers it up:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TYLER Well then, you and I will have a girls' luncheon and gossip about simply everybody! She's about to hurtle into the gossip when Slim turns her head and Mrs. Tyler sees (and we see for the first time) the result of Mitch's brutality: a nasty bruise on Slim's cheek. Mrs. Tyler's face falls as she realizes what this means. Underneath it all, she's a warm person; she hugs Slim:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TYLER Oh baby. Oh baby, I'm so sorry...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a moment; like a mother-daughter tableau... Her tone stays sympathetic, not at all accusatory:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TYLER (CONT.) What did you do? What'd you say to him? Slim freezes. On her sad, shocked reaction -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KITCHEN. DAY. Ginny in the middle of an intense rap. She and Slim are wedged in a corner booth. The off-season lunch rush has died down...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Men are land mines. Some you trigger the first week, others it's years in. Problem is: you want a man man, meaning his veins run thick with testosterone, which is good 'cause he can fuck your brains out but he can also turn around, no warning, and beat your brains out too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never touch Salima. Ginny waves at him: of course not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But the other part, first part: I can - (do that)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Relax, Phil. Nobody's talkin' about your dick here, okay? Phil brings Slim an iced tea and slice of pie:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You went to cops, I hope?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Don't be stupid.) Mitch is in construction, Phil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He knows every cop in the city.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Even if he didn't. My aunt? She got a restraining order? When it was up, this slimeball beat her into a coma.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If he wants to put her in coma, why worry restraining order?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Cause he's a man, Phil! He's psychotic! (calmly, to Slim) You're leaving him today. Right now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shakes her head, trapped) I gotta pick up Gracie at pre-school.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: running toward a car, squealing. They're all blond and adorable, and it takes a moment for us to realize none of them is Gracie. Slim sits in her car in the pick-up line. The Four Girls get in the Volvo station wagon in front of her. The Volvo pulls out, and Slim moves to the front of the line. The very hip PRE-SCHOOL DIRECTOR smiles at Slim:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your husband got her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What??
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Gracie was totally psyched. I told him he should do it more often. Slim nods with feigned casualness and pulls away. Slight smile frozen on her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HER HOME. DAY. She pulls in. No other car there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HER HOME. DAY. She looks around. Nothing abnormal except the quiet. As if they've gone and are never coming back. She digs out her cell phone, punches the first number on the automatic dialer. Presses SEND. Thinks. After one ring, she disconnects. Immediately presses RECALL, then SEND.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How is my little croissant?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's your loaf of bread.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cheerful, no guilt) Oh. Hi. How's it going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zoo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why didn't you tell me you were going to - (pick up Gracie)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I called you at home, left messages - He's interrupted by a LOUD SQUEAL from Gracie, followed by a question, which he answers:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Your Mom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey Moml The elephants are peeing!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pleased with himself for being a good Dad) She's a little excited.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When are you coming home?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. Dinner. It's scary that Mitch will have this conversation in front of Gracie, who's playing at their feet:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It made me nervous when I couldn't reach you. Slim shrugs. He stares at her. Smiles. His voice so soft and calm:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: {CONT.} Do you have any idea how bad things can get?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Educate me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (embarrassed to say it) Slim. I'm a determined person. I was determined to have you, and I did. This house...the company...I am, and always will be, a person who gets what he wants. You can either share in my success or leave us (meaning him and Gracie) right now. Which way you wanna go? Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to be happy. He's not sure of her subtext, but he's willing to give her the benefit of the doubt :
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. With a sudden shock, Slim sees Gracie staring at Mitch: the girl has picked up on his tone. Slim glances at Mitch to see if he notices Gracie's expression. He doesn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Slim looks back at Gracie: still staring at Mitch. If she already senses what's happening, how long before she's affected by it? How long before she sees Mitch become violent? Slim's jaw tightens slightly; her resolve grows stronger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. Mitch asleep, Slim awake, listening. His breathing deep, rhythmic, slight hint of a snore. In the distance, a DOVE coos. She looks at her clock: 2:15. She eases out of bed. Goes into the bathroom. We hear the sound of her peeing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She's no peeing. A BOTTLE is propped up, running water into the toilet as Slim gets dressed. Quickly, silently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. She leans out the bathroom doorway, sees: he's still asleep. She moves quickly, bathroom to hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. Gracie's fast asleep. Slim lifts her up, piles her prized teddy bear on top.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. Slim carries Gracie toward the entrance. We MOVE with her. She's silent, terrified. Glances over her shoulder - No one there. She keeps walking. The eerie sense of a house that's awake rather than asleep. The almost imperceptible but anxiety- provoking SWOOSH of her footsteps... EXTEND the suspense as long as we possibly can...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She reaches the front door. Waits to make sure all is quiet. It is. She turns, looks back down the hall. Empty. Reaches toward the doorknob... hand closer, closer... she starts to turn it -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. Ginny, Phil, and Teddy are clustered under a tree, staring at the house. Waiting. Their VAN is parked down the road. We expect the front door to open any instant. It doesn't. They wait. Casually. Not knowing where Slim was. But we know. Did something go wrong? Slim was right at the door. In a casual way, her rescuers start to wonder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe she didn't hear the signal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She heard it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Teddy's right. She could still be asleep -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's not asleep, okay? She's coming out any second. Phil nods. They wait. She does not come out. Ginny shakes her head, looks at her watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do it again. Teddy nods. Cups his hands, coos like a dove... They wait again. Beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. Slim still frozen in exactly the same spot. Still carrying Gracie, still with her hand on the knob. Listening. Turning her head this way-that way. She hears the COOING DOVE NOISE come again from outside. That settles it. She pulls the door -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - Grabs her, catches her, catches Gracie, pulling Slim's hair hard, leading her away from the door -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. The three rescuers still wait. Frozen. Phil shakes his head. We see a baseball bat in his hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We better go in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It'd be crazy to wake him. If anything's wrong, she'll flick the lights. .Right? Phil nods skeptically, and Ginny herself doesn't seem so sure. They look at the house-and wait. . .and wait... We want to scream: "GO IN! GO! SAVE HER!" Suddenly something. Subtle. Was that A SOUND from inside??? They go on alert. . .step forward... listen more closely... But hear nothing unusual.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Phil. looks at Ginny, shrugs - Ginny shrugs back -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: then darkness. The signal. They run toward the house -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Slim. Intense horrible spit of sound, replaced by an even more horrible silence. Deadly silence. CLOSE ON GINNY as they run: as if we've lost Slim and Ginny's.our new protagonist. As we near the house, we realize: it's not silence. There are sounds from inside: almost inaudible THUDS. Sound of a beating. On Ginny's horrified reaction - Baseball bat. Phil smashes a window. They climb through the hole into the house -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. Silence. They move quickly, carefully toward the living room; it's very dark, we can hardly -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another step and you're dead. Mitch emerges from darkness. Light glints off his pistol. Thirty feet behind him: Gracie's sleeping on the couch. Mitch moves and they stare in horror. Lying at his feet is Slim's body.. Pain springs from Ginny's throat, she rushes to Slim - Mitch rams the gun into her head:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Didn't you hear me?i Ginny feels Slim's pulse, says to Phil:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's alive -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unless you go, your brains'11 be on imy rug i
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir. We are three people. If you kill us all, you will go sure to electric chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I could give a shit. Slim makes a SOUND as Ginny strokes her head... Mitch FIRES the gun into the wall over Ginny's head. Muffled sound: silencer. But he has everyone's attention now:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) This is your last chance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are happy to leave, Sir: with Miss Slim and Gracie. Ginny's helping Slim to her knees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) And make no mistakes. If you keep them here, we will go to police, who will arrest you with pleasure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mitch stares at Phil. Walks to him. Is he going to hit him? Shoot him? Mitch leans in, gun to Phil's head, and whispers:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want to say this in front of the group, but you're just a rug-head, nobody'll believe you. You go to the cops, it's her word against mine. They'll find drugs in her bureau... (before Phil can laugh) Or her car, whatever. (VERY STRONG) Trust me on that. (casual, confident) I'll have custody of Gracie by the end of the week.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And if we take them away, you will shoot all four of us??
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then we die young. The others are uncertain, but Phil helps Slim up; Teddy joins him. Ginny tentatively follows his lead and picks up Gracie..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (This is no good.) You're humiliating him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a little louder) He'll come after me and kill me. Mitch overhears this, smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You hear that? That's why she loves me. (off their horrified looks) Nobody cares like I do. The others stare at him in astonishment, but continue toward the door. Mitch leans toward Slim, whispers:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See you soon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. Gracie awake now in Slim's arms: staring, confused. Gentle rocking of the van. The others barely visible, like shadows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AIRPLANE. DAY. Gracie asleep, Slim holding her. Blinds down, movie playing. Despite Gracie's age, the angle and soft lighting make this resemble a Madonna and child...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NAVY PIER (CHICAGO). EVENING. Open air market: shops, stalls; yuppie heaven. Slim carries Gracie on her shoulders. They're with Jog (her old boyfriend, from the wedding). Horsing around, having a good time, Gracie eating a pastry. They stop and look out at Lake Michigan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow ... whattaya think, Toots?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a big ocean!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well. It's only a lake, but we like it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (nods, stares out... Can we stay here a while?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. They're driving along, suddenly Joe says -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coming up, whattaya say?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bobbing for apples! Slim (front seat) and Gracie (back) both drop their heads so they can't be seen from outside the car - Joe turns the corner, presses a garage door opener, and drives into the basement garage of a nice-looking 4-plex.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. They come in from the garage, throw off their coats. All the curtains in the apartment are drawn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is there anybody who likes ice cream? Gracie whoops - The doorbell rings - 39 Slim and Joe freeze - Slim whips her hand over Gracie's mouth - Gracie looks horrified: why are you covering my - Slim puts her finger to her mouth: shhh. She takes Gracie's hand; they scurry out of sight - Joe hurries to the stereo, puts it on. Music to cover Gracie's "whoop . " He goes to the door, looks through the peep hole. Sees a LARGE MAN IN A SUIT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Can we talk? He holds up an I.D. Not readable through the peep hole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you mind opening up? Joe glances over his shoulder: no sign of them. He opens the door, but not far enough to let the man in. Behind the large man are TWO OTHER MEN IN SUITS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're investigating a kidnapping; we'd like to look around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got a search warrant?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, we got a warrant all right. He slaps a paper and pushes past Joe; the other men follow...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I she the warrant? First FBI Man ignores this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Who're you looking for? The FBI Man gives him a sarcastic glance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) A mother taking her own child isn't kidnapping. I don't think you're
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: at all. This elicits no response. Joe moves to where he can see the other two guys. Looks down the hall toward:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: searching the pantry, looking around. He opens the door to the garage and vanishes -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: looks under the bed, in the closets... yanks clothes aside. At any moment we expect him to find them...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mister: unless you leave right now, I'm calling the police.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh...jeez...that's a scary thought. Joe picks up the phone - First FBI Man slams it down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I marri a cop, okay? I'm not in the mood. Joe accepts this. . .but only for the moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. Second FBI Man looks in the car, under the car... isn't this the logical place for them to hide???
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LIVING ROOM. NIGHT. Third FBI Man returns from the bedroom emptyhanded, starts to search the living room:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll look around here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. The Second FBI Man returns from the garage, starts to search... We're scared with every cupboard he opens that he'll find them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. Third FBI Man searches the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: we go to SLIM'S POV...she and Gracie are in a cabinet, looking out through a narrow horizontal slit. Watching the Third FBI Man makes his way methodically in their direction. First FBI Man stands over Joe, keeping him silent. Joe watches the Third FBI Man search the room... And then Joe blinks. Moves his eyes, and looks right in Slim's direction. He realizes where they must be hiding. The Third FBI Man's getting closer and closer to them... Joe realizes he has to do something. Abruptly Joe stands:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's enough. (VERY FORCEFUL) You hear me? It's time to go. Now. (off First FBI's. shocked look) I know who you are, okay? I know who hired you. First FBI Man whirls. Suddenly he's got a knife in his hand. Definitely NOT FBI. Putting the. knife to Joe's throat:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah? You know what it feels like to have a knife hit your carotid?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (trying not to move) No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Inside the cabinet, Gracie gasps. Slim puts a hand over her mouth. But Slim herself has to fight the impulse to burst out of there to save Joe -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what it's like to bleed out in less than two minutes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (stopping his search) Oh please, John Boy. Not the shiv
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm just going to cut him a little - Slim's eyes bulge -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are not going to cut him!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I sure as hell am! Slim's on the verge of bursting out when "Second FBI" enters:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: John Boy, this is not listed on the program. Come on, they're not here; let's ride.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't I just - (cut him a little}
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! No slice and dice! They head for the door. As he goes, "First FBI Man" (a.k.a. John Boy) runs his knife along the couch, spilling out its contents... .passes the tv set and stabs the tube... .runs his knife along the wall, making a vicious scary mark. And they vanish. We hear the door SLAM. The horizontal band through which Slim was looking widens - 43 The cabinet door falls open, Slim and Gracie come out. Gracie's crying. Slim hugs her, says to Joe:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus, are you okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess. (feels his neck) I needed a shave, anyway. The phone rings. They look at it. It can't be who they think it is... it rings again. Joe goes to it. Hesitates. Answers:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello?

direction.raw_text: . DAY. Ginny comes off a plane with her two kids. in tow, looks around, heads for a bank of telephones... As she approaches, one of the phones starts to ring. Ginny looks at it with irritation, picks it up -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the most ridiculous thing I've ever done.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh yeah? How 'bout Horace? Ginny glances at one of her kids, evidently Horace's child.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, this is the second most -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rent a car, drive to Denver, then fly to Reno.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're out of your mind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (as though flattered) You noticed. Dialtone. We watch from a distance as Ginny shakes her head in disbelief, mutters to her kids. As they trudge off, the CAMERA FOLLOWS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . RENTAL CAR COUNTER. DAY. From the same distance: Ginny and kids approach the counter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . RENT-A-CAR AREA. DAY. Ginny loading luggage into the back as her kids climb in. As Ginny slams the trunk, SOMEONE'S RIGHT THERE - Slim. Ginny blinks, recognizes her, hugs her:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What're you... (doing here?) I thought we were... (driving to Reno)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had to make sure you weren't followed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (re Slim's hair) I like it. (not so sure) Maybe. (SEES GRACIE) Hey, Graceland. Gracie slips out from behind Slim, goes and hugs Ginny as Slim holds up a wallet:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a credit card and cash. It's on me, but make no calls home, or to Phil. Think of it as a vacation till the Orca reopens. Toots?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This to Gracie, who started to climb into the car. Gracie looks at Slim and again tries to climb in - she wants }}g part of saying goodbye - but Slim pulls her back into a hug. Slim holds her for as long as Gracie can possibly tolerate. When Slim is done, Gracie climbs into the car with Ginny's kids. Slim has tears in her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take care of her, okay? Extra ice- cream and... and if you need to reach me... (hands her a cell phone) Just don't call your friends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh great. I'll call strangers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In an emergency, I'm #1 on the auto- dialer. Or I'll call you. Any calls between us must run is seconds or less. Cake?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ass. (re the vacation) Enjoy it, huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How long?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The custody hearing's end of next month. That's my deadline.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deadline for what? Slim looks at her...
direction.name: direction

result.heading: CAN'T TELL WHAT WE'RE LOOKING AT

direction.raw_text: WE CAN'T TELL WHAT WE'RE LOOKING AT. CAMERA SLOWLY PULLS BACK: EYES ...SLIM'S EYES. Intense, focussed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You ready? She nods. CAMERA CONTINUES BACK, we see more of her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure? Another nod. Perspiration streaming from her pores, running down her face. And a look we haven't seen before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you lose? She shakes her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can he hurt you? She barely dignifies the question with another shake. We're now far enough back to see we are:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. Slim in a leotard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Even though he's bigger?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (v. quiet) He's a lot bigger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Even though he's stronger? Finally see her INSTRUCTOR (6'4", 235 pounds, African-American,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .4% body fat).
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's a lot stronger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So if he hits you -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It takes.twice as much energy to swing and miss as to swing and hit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After he misses, what do you do? She answers him with an intense look. He nods and moves after her. Slow, strong, powerful: predator. She backs up. Her movements simple, graceful, economical but athletic: they remind us of the easy way she moved around the restaurant in the first scene... Scattered over the mat are old-fashioned plastic SANTAS that kids use as punching bags. He backs her toward one... .then another. As she nears them, she slides deftly to the side: like she has eyes in the back of her head... He maneuvers her toward a desk-her back to it... Rushes at her - For a moment she seems trapped - But as he reaches her, she slips to her left, tosses him over the desk and onto the mat. She moves quickly to an attacking position, standing over him. He pats the mat beside him. She sits. He makes a motion and she closes her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One last thing. The hardest lesson: we can't control the universe. She listens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) The unexpected may happen. He slides his hand over the mat, an order. She lies down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Suddenly his maid enters, you're distracted for an instant, and he hits you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not possible -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We must prepare even for the impossible. She stirs slightly, uncomfortable with this idea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) We bend the universe to our will, but it will only go so far.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're saying -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) For the sake of this exercise, he hits me. He's standing over her. She looks completely vulnerable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. And you lie there as if dead. But hear me. Hold onto my voice. She nods almost imperceptibly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) He's standing over you, he thinks he's won-and as sure as he's a coward, he'll try to kick you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And because you know what he'll do, you're smiling inside,... (CONT.) Her face blank, eyes still closed-but something changes; we sense her confidence and serenity returning. He draws his foot back as if to kick her...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (San Francisco) DAY. Slim strides through the office unapologetically interrupting various conversations. Finally she spots Jupiter, walks over, and without saying a word, demands his attention -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to the others) Ah. Just a sec, I'll be right back. (to her, irritated} I thought I made it clear you weren't supposed to come here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't care what you want. This almost makes him smile; he's getting to like her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a different person.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's that black guy I .set you up with?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did he teach you how to think? It's not the question she expected; it's more interesting and complicated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .I hope so. (before he can speak) The English guy is good too. (ALL BUSINESS) But that's not why I'm here. I need a woman who looks like me. Someone who can handle herself: an off-duty cop or something. (hands him photo) Five four, one ten. Hair like this but cut higher, over the ear - (hands him key) Miko hotel, room 509, 8 o'clock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tonic ? That's awful short notice; I don't know if I can -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? I thought Jupiter was like all-powerful, king of the Gods? Oh yeah. One more thing. At some point.. .not right now 'cause it'd be phony ...I need you to acknowledge that I'm your kid. She walks away. He stares after her. Hint of a smile comes to his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. Slim is signing the credit card slip as the CLERK puts the merchandise in a distinctive red bag -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sure this'll work?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You bet your life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks, I will. She leaves, taking out her cell phone. FOLLOW HER as she goes:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. She walks up the street, punches in a number...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tyler residence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Tony. Could you please tell Mrs. Tyler that I'll call her around f our this afternoon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course, Miss Slim. My pleasure. Slim hangs up, goes into a. bagel shop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .. BAGEL PLACE. LATER. Slim sits at a table with a cup of coffee. A short guy, 28, built like a fireplug, dressed in sweater and jeans and wool cap, enters, walks to her, and says in an English accent:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Today, hon, you graduate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .A. STREET. DAY. Alex and Slim are across the street from a strip joint.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's closed?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Till six, eh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I'd guess whoever owns it isn't a very nice person.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's a safe one. Slim starts walking toward the shop. As they go:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've got soft hands, you've worked hard. The tricky part now is nerves. They reach the entryway; Slim takes out her tools.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People on the street?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. And you have to go in when his alarm's turned off -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meaning he's inside. (has tools out) I'm ready. Alex moves slightly to block the view as Slim bends over and slips her tool into the lock... Slim working quietly, concentrating... Alex looking. around...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: noticing them. Hesitating. Coming over..
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We got company, doll... Slim still working... The Shady Character has almost reached them...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget it. You're too slow. She opens the door - Alex glances down, nods - She closes the door again and stands just as:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. What're you guys up to? Slim stares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We were hoping to see some action, but it looks like they're closed. The Shady Character stares back. He is ve skeptical. He watches Slim and Alex walk off down the block. Alex mutters under his breath:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Action?" Off her grin -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. Slim sits in a chair, cell phone at her ear. Her hair is done; now she's getting a manicure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TYLER'S VOICE And where is Gracie?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's coming day after tomorrow, then we're flying to L.A. I was thinking after the hearing, maybe I could bring her by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . TYLER'S VOICE Tell me something. Why is this call different? You were always worried about how long we talked -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was out in the country, Mrs. T. I'm in a big city now, meeting with my lawyer, so there're lots of cell phones. No one can trace this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. Slim exits in a long gray coat. Stops outside for one moment, glances around - Sees a guy in a GREEN TRENCHCOAT across the street. She walks hurriedly away. Glances over her shoulder, sees Trenchcoat following her. She smiles slightly, to herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. From a discreet distance, across the street, we watch her go into her hotel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trenchcoat is standing across the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. Slim enters her suite. Sitting by the window is TOVA. As Slim walks over, Tova pulls on a wig which matches Slim's haircut. There is now a strong resemblance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm Tova Steinberg. Slim stares. Tova's voice is an octave lower than Slim's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say something else.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was a cop. I got shot, took the benefits. Slim thinks about Tova's voice. Takes out her cell phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They have to think I'm still here, so use my cell phone, tomorrow, to call my dad. Autodial 2. Slim presses the autodial number, then SEND, and motions for Tova to put on Slim's gray coat. It fits Tova perfectly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) (lowering his voice) Hey, it's me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened to your voice?; you okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know, I'm getting some bronchial thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Otherwise everything's okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get some rest, huh? She presses END, says to Tova, back to normal voice:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tomorrow stay in, order room service. Call him twice. Keep it brief. "Hello, I don't feel well..."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And tonight?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go around the corner, eat at Guido's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be followed?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Green trenchcoat. Tova nods and Slim takes off her own wig. Short dark hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Wish me luck, huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good luck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luck has nothing to do with it. Tova smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HALL. NIGHT. Slim waiting as the Service Elevator arrives. Gets in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . REAR ENTRANCE. NIGHT. Slim going out the door, down the alley...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . AIRPORT. NIGHT. Slim getting on the plane to Los Angeles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. Slim parks, looks across at a warehouse converted into lofts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She takes a duffle from the back seat. Steps into the shadows, stares at the warehouse: Brick building, modern door and light fixtures.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She looks both ways: The street's dark. Deserted. She hoists her duffle, takes a deep breath. And crosses the street. Goes up the stairs to the stoop. Looks at the alarm panel on the door: green. Crouches, starts to work on the lock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SLEEPING AREA. NIGHT. Mitch in bed, sleeping. Peaceful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Off. He stirs slightly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He sits up. Frowning... dazed. Cocks his head. Listens... The SILENCE seems to have texture. He gets up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We glimpse: a beautiful brick warehouse converted inside into an open, loft-like space filled with bird'seye maple, metal beams, etc. Modern, glistening, expensive. He walks around the place in the dark. In his boxer shorts and t-shirt. He looks vulnerable...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... From one corner. Observing him. She has become the stalker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: watching... He decides everything's okay and goes back to the semi partitioned sleeping area... He gets back into bed - next to a YOUNG BLOND WOMAN, 22. She turns over, mutters something, goes back to sleep. He lies there, eyes open. Stays very still. Listening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MORNING. Bright light. Mitch in his bathrobe making coffee. The Young Blond Woman comes out, fully dressed...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coffee?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I gotta get home, change for work. He nods, gives her a perfunctory kiss:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll call you. She stares at him a second.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want my number?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. She sees how "eager" he is to talk to her again. Irritated, she scribbles the number quickly, hands.it to him -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks for everything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For the sex, in other words. She gives it right back to him:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You too. I really appreciate it. He's too self-centered to notice her ironic tone. She lets herself out. The instant she does, we go to a HIGH ANGLE looking down at Mitch. Alternate NORMAL and HIGH ANGLE during: Mitch pours coffee, goes back into his "dressing area" and pulls on some clothes as he talks into his cell phone:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Janie? Hey. (BEAT) Yeah, I was working late. (BEAT) No, tonight's no good either. I've got a morning flight to San Francisco. Slim in therafters, listening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) If it was pleasure, you'd be going too. No, I'm going down to get my daughter. Slim's reaction to this...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Sure, the custody hearing's here next week, but it looks like Gracie's being brought to San Francisco and my ex-wife ...well, seems like she completely vanished.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . His words echo his threats when he was trying to strangle her in her hallway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Right off the face of the earth. I doubt they'll ever find her this time. Slim's jaw tightens. When we come back to Mitch, he's dressed and packing his briefcase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Yeah, I want her to meet you. We'll call when we get in. (FAKE TENDER:) You too. He hangs up, takes a sip of coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: SHOT looking down on Mitch as he heads out the door. Slim waits in the rafters until the alarm system beeps: it's armed. She climbs down, walks into the kitchen. Notices his Mr. Coffee machine is still on. Hesitates, turns it off. Opens the fridge to find something to eat - The alarm beeps again. Slim drops silently to the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of the KEY IN THE LOCK - Slim scuttles away as we hear:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FOOTSTEPS coming toward her. She slips around the edge of the counter just as: Mitch enters the kitchen. He goes to the Mr. Coffee... Looks at it... Frowns. Didn't he leave it on...? Slim in the foreground, crouched down, Mitch 15 feet away. He looks around. Is something wrong? Is someone here? Slim frozen, trying not to breath. Mitch listening. Wondering: should he search the place? She looks for a place to hide - He looks at his watch. He's late. He walks right toward Slim, curls around the counter - But she's not there any longer. He heads for the front door - 102 Goes out. HOLD ON the hall, where she was, where he walked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The alarm beeps again as he resets it. One silent beat, then Slim rises in the kitchen. (She did a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .) She sighs. Pours herself some coffee, replaces the liquid with water. Auto-dials her cell phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you stay off the phone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For you, honey? (Anything.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hope so. She hangs up. Retrieves her duffle bag from its hiding place and pulls out tools, equipment, etc. Picks up a screwdriver and starts searching the apartment, checking the phone line, following it to the place where it enters the apartment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of Slim' a face: a running tab on her emotions. Intensity, focus, determination, fear,. ..and, as the sequence builds: concern about what she doing...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She disconnects the phone line. Finds the electrical box, opens it, finds the main switch. Removes all the knives from the kitchen... hides them... Walks the apartment-familiarizing herself with every inch of it-occasionally she moves a piece of furniture slightly... we realize: she's assessing fighting spaces. angles... She looks from one piece of furniture to another, back and forth, gauging the distance between them. She eats a snack from his refrigerator...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks out the back (bedroom) window... and sees the water of the J San Pedro harbor below her. Uses a metal detector to search the apartment: in a drawer of the night table beside his bed, she finds a pistol. Removes it. There are papers in the same drawer, notes or something. She throws these in the trash. She takes out three letters. As the CAMERA sweeps over one of them, we hear her voice:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . .thanks for letting me come talk about Gracie. And I'm glad you're willing to admit your temper, and - let's not mince words - the physical abuse you subjected me to." And glances at SECOND LETTER:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.0.) "Perhaps with your new attitude, we can really work something out. Per your last letter, I'll see you the evening of..." She puts the letters in the drawer where the pistol was. They're not in envelopes; they're loose, open. She picks up the metal detector, resumes her search. The machine beeps insistently around his desk. She can't find anything. Finally she discovers a false bottom on one of the drawers: a second gun is in there. With the gun are papers: reports from private detectives looking for her, an assessment of his custody rights... She hides the guns in the bottom of the laundry hamper. Finds a photo of herself with Mitch and Gracie. Rips it up. Puts the metal detector back in the duffle. Changes into sweatshirt and sweatpants. Takes the distinctive red bag (from the electronics store) out of the duffle. There's a machine inside. She plugs it in, tucks it behind the couch. Puts her cell phone beside it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She makes one last check: every wall, surface, every drawer. Barefoot, she begins to glide around the space. Backing up. Moving with ease and grace, sliding deftly to the side as she approaches a couch, desk, chair. She's building on her earlier reconnaissance: learning where the furniture is and how to navigate around it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MAGIC HOUR. Light fading toward darkness. She's still moving backward, only now her sliding is smooth, graceful; almost a dance. As if hearing a distant signal, she slows to a stop. For a long moment she stands perfectly still. Poised. Like an animal in the forest. There's a chair facing the front door. She glances at it. No. She walks behind the couch, turns off the machine, picks up her cell phone and auto-dials.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey. Slim says nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) You okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say it again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know. What you told me. Beat. On Slim's face as:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. You have a divine animal right to protect your own life and the life of your offspring. Silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. She hangs up, turns the machine back on and stashes her cell phone. With simple ease, she lowers herself onto the chair. Facing the door. Waiting in the fading light...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NIGHT. Mitch walks down the street. Up the steps, punches in his alarm code.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MITCH'S PLACE. NIGHT. Mitch enters, closes and locks the door. Turns on the light. He walks back to the rear of the space, hangs up his coat. Goes into the bedroom area, takes off his jacket. The lights go out. Mitch freezes, shadow on shadow, a silhouette in the darkness. He looks out the window, sees: The neighboring buildings still have light and power. He cocks his head, listening. Silence. Walks to the door of the bedroom area. Waits. Take two more steps -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's me. He nods slowly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. (I thought so.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He moves quietly to the bed... to the night table where Slim found the pistol. Covers this by talking:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: {CONT.} This morning too?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You always did forget to turn off the coffee. He rummages in the drawer. We hear the RUSTLE of the letters Slim put there. He fails to find the gun. Gives up trying to be quiet, tosses papers onto the floor -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: {CONT.} I found it, Mitch. His hand leaves the drawer. He thinks. Picks up the phone, listens. Dead. Looks around... can't see her... Goes back to the chair where he hung his sports coat and fishes out his cell phone. We see the GLOW of its dial. He punches 911 and pressed SEND. The dial goes dark for two seconds, then blinks back on. He stares at it. Tries again. 911, SEND. Again it goes dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a machine. Knocks out cell phones. He throws the cell phone onto the bed. Walks out of the bedroom area. Looks around the vast space. Spooky. Slanting light and dense shadow. He doesn't see her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Walks toward his desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I found that gun too. He stops. Doesn't know where to go. or what to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Scared?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now is when you decide, Mitch. (off his silence) Whether you're a coward. If you are, you can run. I won't stop you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (meaning the match is unfair:) You have my guns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Threw 'em away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then someone's here with you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're alone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Cause it'd be stupid. Silence is her answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) You're sayin' this is man to man?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Woman, Mitch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what I meant: man against woman - you sure that's fair? The lights go back on. Slowly Slim comes out from hiding...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fair to whom? As he realizes her meaning, she moves into the open area between two couches. She has no weapon. She's barefoot, in her sweats, feet spread for balance, arms just slightly raised. Compared to him: she's tiny. He moves toward her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is what you wanted, right? What you were going to San Francisco for: the chance to get me alone? He lunges for her; she slides to the side and he misses. He begins to stalk her. And as he stalks, she moves backward, slowly and gracefully, in the way she was practicing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't understand, Slim. How does this work for you? She ignores his words. Watches his eyes and his chest. Wants to know where he's going to attack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) I mean: this is carefully thought out, right? She does not respond. He throws three punches. None of them hits her. He's unfazed, keeps stalking...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) But say you succeed - beat me up or whatever. You're not going to murder me... (CONT.) Her expression remains neutral, focused. He takes this to be agreement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) So all you've done is further piss me off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Self defense is not ,murder. This stops him cold.. He lowers his hands a moment. Stares at her, trying to assimilate this new information...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't have the guts. She just looks at him. He blinks, worried for an instant. Covers it with a smile:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not self-defense when you break in here and attack me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So far you're attacking me. He lunges, almost hits her, rushes in - She has to leap sideways with great speed and dexterity: jumps over the couch to avoid being hit. He also jumps over the couch, but his balance isn't as good, and she's waiting for him as he stumbles - With perfect balance and full force, she slugs him in the nose. He goes down. Stays there. For the first time it occurs to him: this might not be easy. He climbs to his feet, feels his nose: blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You see? I'm just defending myself. He resumes stalking her. Only he's angry now, and it's scary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you fail, you can count on this: you'll never see Gracie again. She reacts - He sees it, rushes her - Punching as he goes. From the standpoint of pure physics, he makes a terrifying force. Until: She steps back, grabs his arm, whips him vs. the brick wall - He hits it, bounces off. Cut on his forehead, blood streaming down his face. He stares at her... breathing hard... trying to put it together:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You really (think) ...you think you'll kill me and get away with it?l
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you. Self-defense. I came here, as arranged in our letters, to talk about Gracie -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Letters? There are no -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the drawer where your pistol was. You just left prints all over them. He stares at her, stunned in every way. Touches his forehead, feels the blood...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You attacked me, I fought back. And of course if you never touch me... (SWEET SMILE) I'll have to give myself bruises... He goes berserk. Leaps at her, covering ground quickly with his long stride, swinging his massive arms. This is the most terrifying form of combat: a huge person attacking a tiny one. If he should hit her even once, a glancing blow, she will go down, she will break, it will be over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But he misses, and misses again. Sometimes his punches are wild, almost comical. Others come so close we hear-the wind, feel their power, feel his sweat on her...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: this terrifying choreographed dance with destruction for as long as it will hold. At every instant, we fear for her bones and her life. Sometimes she leans back like Muhammad Ali to barely slip a punch, and we see terror on her face, married to determination. She knows the score. and the odds. Finally, in frustration at so many misses, he grabs an ashtray, hurls.it at her - it flies over her head - He punches again and again, wildly. She remains untouched. He stops. With all the blood, he looks like a wild animal. He makes a great effort to pull himself together...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This doesn't bother me, Slim. I don't care how long it takes. We both know: Ionly have to hit you once. Once, and it's over. She laughs at him. This is the last thing he expected and the last thing he can stand. He rushes at her again, fast - She starts left - He blocks her way - She starts right - Again he's blocking her - She lunges to the left, through a narrow space - He punches, grazing her hair; punches again, just missing, and a third time. We feel the awesome power behind these blows. She's in the clear again. Smiles casually. Clearly part of her strategy is to keep him angry:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm confused, Mitchy. Aren't you a man? (QUOTING HIM) I thought it was "no contest?" I mean, can't you hit me even once? He grabs a lamp, yanks out the cord, wields it like a club.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) (AMUSED) A weapon? He smashes the lamp down, just missing her head -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) It's a martial-arts cliche, honey. A weapon throws you off balance -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He misses her three times, the last time smashing the lamp into the wall so hard that the impact hurts his hand. He yelps -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) You see? He turns toward her, pain on his face, holding his hand - And she truly attacks for the first time. Smashes her fist against his head - He flies back, bounces vs. the wall. As he comes off it, she punches him again - He roars with rage, lunges at her, head first, great speed - She hurtles him in the same direction, increasing speed - Right into the opposite wall. The top of his head hits the wall. He shudders like someone in a cartoon: a spasm running head to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He drops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Face down. Does not move. At all. She stares at him. Goes to him. Wary. Gives him a reflex test - No reaction. He's unconscious. She tests his neck for a pulse. Apparently he's still alive, because she raises her hand over her head. Her palm vertical, like a knife. She's about to deliver a karate chop. To his neck. it will break his neck. It will kill him. Her hand stays there, poised. CAMERA PLUNGES IN ON HER FACE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - Mitch hitting her the first time - - Midwest house, Mitch leaping out from Gracie's doorway - - Mitch beating her as she crawls across the floor of their house. (Something we didn't see before.) She reaches up, flicks the light switch; Mitch jumps on her back - - Mitch: "You'll never see Gracie again." - Earlier: "She's My daughter. Don't even think about taking her." - Strangling Slim, whispering: "...where you're going, they will never... ever... find you."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Face contorted in rage, confusion - She brings her hand down - Misses. him. Intentionally. Turns away, tears in her eyes. She retrieves her cell phone, turns off the cell-phone blocker, presses redial. Stares out the window. We see the turmoil on her face, hear it in her voice:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't, Gin.

direction.raw_text: 'Re you okay?

direction.raw_text: Yeah.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It worked?!

direction.raw_text: Listen to me! I did it, but I can't do it! I can't kill him! Behind Slim, out of focus: movement, a soft blur...

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) (URGENTLY) Slim. He'll come after you -

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) He'll come after Gracie - 115 An indistinct shape, something rising over her head...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know all that! I have to, but I can't! I'm not a killer! I'm not him! Mitch. Crazed and bloody face. In his hand: the wooden lamp. She senses something, turns her head slightly to one side - - so the lamp does not land quite flush on her skull. Still sends her crashing to the floor. Now she does not move. He stands over her. Looks insane: bloody, dazed, beaten: but triumphant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello? Slim? You there? The lamp moving in his hand. He's rotating it. A simple menacing image... . and we realize: he' s aoinq to hit her again.

direction.raw_text: {CONT.} Should I call the cops?! Answer me?! He's distracted by Ginny's voice. Picks up the phone.

direction.raw_text: Listen to me, bitch. Ginny's silent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) if you value your children, don' t call anybody. It's over, okay? It's all over. He throws the phone on the couch and moves back toward Slim, lamp clenched tight in his fist.

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) You're ready... Mitch sees the slight smile, can't believe it - Rage. He pulls his foot back to kick her - Her eyes are open, just a slit - His foot swinging forward... As it reaches her, she grabs it, yanks it - He's pulled off his feet, crashing down on top of her - But she's already rolling, out from under him... and up - Coming to her feet - He starts to rise, all fours, then into a crouch and ug...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She's ready. Her face alert. Center of gravity low. Arm low,.fist low... As her motion unfurls: Boxers say that an uppercut, perfectly executed, is the most difficult, powerful, and beautiful of punches. Indeed: when an uppercut starts low for maximum center-of- gravity and hits the opponent flush on the point of the chin - as Slim's does here - it delivers a devastating message to the central nervous system, short-circuiting it completely. Mitch flies backward... There's a table behind him. His head cracks on the table. His neck snaps. He lands on the floor: twisted, broken. Slim stares at him. There's no way a living man could assume the position now occupied by her former husband.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She stares in disbelief. Though she knows the answer, she feels his carotid artery. Her face registers what she feels. Horror, relief. She walks slowly to her cell phone, picks it up. Listens: no one there. She presses redial, waits...
